Interface IOIDC

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OIDCImpl

    public interface IOIDC
    Interface of Mobile Connect SDK

    • Method Detail

      • startAuthentication

        void startAuthentication(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult,
                       java.lang.String redirectURI,
                       java.lang.String state,
                       java.lang.String nonce,
                       java.lang.String scope,
                       java.lang.Integer maxAge,
                       java.lang.String acrValues,
                       java.lang.String encryptedMSISDN,
                       AuthenticationOptions options,
                       IStartAuthenticationCallback callback)
                         throws OIDCException,
                                DiscoveryResponseExpiredException
        Starts the authentication/authorization process based on the supplied options and a previously obtained discovery result.

        This will form an authentication/authorization request and initiate the request.

        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - Result from discovery which contains the endpoints and application credentials. (Required).
        redirectURI - On completion or error where the result information is sent using a HTTP 302 redirect. (Required).
        state - Application specified unique scope value.
        nonce - Application specified nonce value. (Required).
        scope - Requested scope. (Optional). If omitted or empty defaults to the value "openid".
        maxAge - Requested maximum time in seconds since last user authentication. (Optional). If omitted or empty defaults to the value 3600.
        acrValues - Requested Authentication Context class Reference (Optional). If omitted or empty defaults to the value "2" .
        encryptedMSISDN - Encrypted MSISDN for user if returned from discovery service. (Optional).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        OIDCException
        DiscoveryResponseExpiredException - Thrown if the discovery response has expired.

      • parseAuthenticationResponse

        void parseAuthenticationResponse(java.lang.String redirectURL,
                               IParseAuthenticationResponseCallback callback)
                                 throws OIDCException
        Allows an application to obtain parameters which have been passed within an authentication/authorization code response via a redirect URL.

        The function will parse the redirectURL and parse out the components expected for authentication/authorization:

        • error
        • error_description
        • error_uri
        • state
        • code
        Parameters:
        redirectURL - The URL which has been subject to redirection from the discovery service. (Required).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        OIDCException

      • requestToken

        void requestToken(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult,
                java.lang.String redirectURI,
                java.lang.String code,
                TokenOptions options,
                IRequestTokenCallback callback)
                  throws OIDCException,
                         DiscoveryResponseExpiredException
        Allows an application to use the authorization code obtained from authentication/authorization to obtain an access token and related information from the authorization server.

        It is expected the application is in possession of a valid discovery result and authentication code prior to calling this function.

        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - Result from discovery which contains the endpoints and application credentials. (Required).
        redirectURI - Confirms the redirectURI that the application used when the authorization request. (Required).
        code - The authorization code provided to the application via the call to the authentication/authorization API. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        OIDCException
        DiscoveryResponseExpiredException - Thrown if the discovery response has expired.

      • parseIDToken

        void parseIDToken(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult,
                java.lang.String id_token,
                TokenOptions options,
                IParseIDTokenCallback callback)
                  throws OIDCException,
                         DiscoveryResponseExpiredException
        Allows an application to extract the various components within an ID token and have the signature validated (optionally).
        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - Result from discovery which contains the endpoints and application credentials. (Required).
        id_token - The id_token returned from a request to obtain a token from the authentication/authorization server. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response.
        Throws:
        OIDCException
        DiscoveryResponseExpiredException - Thrown if the discovery response has expired.
